headline: Trump Meets With NATO Chief. What It Means for Defense Stocks.
summary: Earnings for the U.S. defense sector are coming just about a week after President Donald Trump and NATO General Secretary Mark Rutte meet on Monday.  Shares of large American defense contractors have had a tough few months, but things should get better, though, according to one Wall Street analyst.  Trump has criticized NATO for its EU member nations falling short of their NATO contributions and failing to spend more on their own national defense—leaving the U.S. to pick up the slack.

headline: RTX's Raytheon Unit Secures a Contract to Aid RAM GMLS Program
summary: Raytheon's $74 million contract win boosts RTX's missile defense role as RAM GMLS expands global naval deployment.

headline: LRT Capital Management June 2025 Investor Update
summary: During the month of June the LRT Global Opportunities strategy returned -1.30% net of fees. Year-to-date, the strategy has returned +8.12%. Read more here.

headline: Northrop Grumman Surprise Blow For F/A-XX After Boeing F-47 Win
summary: Northrop Grumman's pole position for the F/A-XX contract is threatened by shifting Pentagon funding priorities and possible program delays. See why NOC stock is a Hold.
